definition: A comparative adverb used to express a preference or inclination towards something or someone, often used in the context of expressing a personal liking or fondness. It is commonly used to compare two or more options and indicate a stronger preference for one over the others.

examples.german: Ich trinke lieber Tee als Kaffee.
examples.english: I prefer to drink tea rather than coffee.

examples.german: Ich gehe lieber ins Kino als ins Theater.
examples.english: I prefer to go to the cinema rather than the theater.

examples.german: Ich würde lieber zu Hause bleiben.
examples.english: I would rather stay at home.

examples.german: Ich esse lieber Pizza als Pasta.
examples.english: I prefer to eat pizza rather than pasta.

examples.german: Ich würde lieber ans Meer fahren.
examples.english: I would rather go to the sea.
